title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2004.1 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2004.1 - Definitions

State Regulations

As used in this Part: (a) Limitation means the continuance of a
college or vocational institution's or a lender's eligibility, subject to
compliance with special conditions or restrictions which have been set as a
result of a failure to comply with applicable law, regulations or
agreements. (b) Suspension means
the removal of an institution's or a lender's eligibility (or portions thereof)
for a specified period of time or until the occurrence of one or more specified
conditions. (c) Termination means
the unqualified removal of an institution's or lender's eligibility (or
portions thereof) for an indefinite period of time. (d) Exception status means the removal of
loan applications from standard processing procedures in order to conduct a
further review of such applications, obtain additional information or verify
information contained therein from the applicants or others. (e) Loans shall include New York Higher

Education Loan Program (NYHELPs) loans as set forth in article 14 of the New

York State Education Law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
2004.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
